cont.entity_a: Comfortable for over an hour of wear.
cont.entity_b: Comfortable for short periods but may cause ear discomfort over time. Comfortable for extended wear but not as compact as other models.

cont.entity_a: Reveals more details and clearer sound than other headphones at a similar price. Not harsh sounding like many inexpensive headphones. Great for monitoring sound in recording settings. Impressive bass and good sound across all frequencies. Headphones are not suitable for audiophiles but provide great sound for the price.
cont.entity_b: Sound quality is good, comparable to more expensive models. Great for reducing airplane noise and other low-frequency sounds. Good value for the price with satisfactory sound quality. Effective at reducing low-frequency noise but not higher frequencies.

cont.entity_a: Headband takes time to stretch for larger heads, and plastic construction is unimpressive. Plastic parts, particularly the connection between ear cup and base, are prone to breaking. Build quality is poor due to weak and thin plastic materials. Earpieces can snap off easily during normal use. Ear cushions deteriorate over time and need replacement. Plastic headband can break, and the warranty requires payment for shipping.
cont.entity_b: Durable and sound great, but foam ear pads disintegrate over time. Adjustability becomes loose with wear. Foam pads need frequent replacement. Battery compartment is flimsy and can break easily.

cont.entity_a: Lifetime warranty is available, but replacement process involves shipping costs.

cont.entity_b: Noise cancellation is minimal, mainly a white noise hiss. Noise cancellation function is less effective compared to higher-end models. Noise cancellation works well for low frequencies but adds a background hum. Noise cancellation feature is not as effective as advertised.
Some issues with static and distortion after extended use.
